message.content:
cs.CL, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.IR, cs.CV. 

This paper presents a new Convolutional Neural Network (CNN) model for text classification that jointly exploits labels on documents and their component sentences. The paper focuses on natural language processing (NLP) tasks such as text classification, which falls under the category of computational linguistics (cs.CL). The use of CNNs for text classification is a popular approach in machine learning (cs.LG) and artificial intelligence (cs.AI). The paper also discusses the importance of explanations for its predictions, which is a topic of interest in information retrieval (cs.IR) and computer vision (cs.CV).
